Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by emmababe I'm 29 and recently found a large egg size lump in the bottom of my breast. I have no idea how long it has been there as even afew hrs before I found it, I didn't notice it when I took a shower. I went to the doc the next day. After examining me she said normally they are not allowed to refer someone of my age, I would have to wait a month and if it was still there go bk and get refered then. However she said in my case she wanted to do an urgent referal right away! Now I'm really anxious! I know I'm young so the odds r in my favor, but I'm really worried now! Any other young women had lumps on here? I hope you get checked out really quick!
Posts.Title: large lump and urgent referral... only 29?!

Posts.Content: Hi, I am not too sure if it is customary to have PET with Mammograms that often, but my 11 yr old son has been fighting Hodgkins for about 3 yrs now, and he has to have PET & CT every 3 months. Hope this helps!!
Posts.Title: PET Scan Question
